body: I began by trying to untangle the mutual `friend`-ness of `SavedVariable` and `VariableVersion`. For this I had to move the `VariableVersion` pointer out of the `SavedVariable`. At that point the struct became a bit useless. I also did some static analysis in my head to find that `saved_version.defined()` would only be false when the `SavedVariable` is default constructed. It's like 100 lines less code overall so I thought it would be nice.

At that point the struct became a bit useless. I also did some static analysis in my head to find that saved_version.defined() would only be false when the SavedVariable is default constructed. It's like 100 lines less code overall so I thought it would be nice.
body_text: I began by trying to untangle the mutual friend-ness of SavedVariable and VariableVersion. For this I had to move the VariableVersion pointer out of the SavedVariable. At that point the struct became a bit useless. I also did some static analysis in my head to find that saved_version.defined() would only be false when the SavedVariable is default constructed. It's like 100 lines less code overall so I thought it would be nice.
